about.name: Annecy
about.info_text: Annecy is a charming town in southeastern France, often referred to as the 'Venice of the Alps' due to its picturesque canals, cobbled streets, and stunning alpine backdrop. This delightful destination is known for its well-preserved medieval old town, Lake Annecy, and the surrounding snow-capped mountains. Visitors can explore the historic streets, enjoy water activities on the lake, and savor the local cuisine in cozy cafes and restaurants. Annecy is a true gem for nature lovers, history enthusiasts, and those seeking a romantic escape.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 53,000
Region: Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes
Time Zone: Central European Time (CET, UTC+01:00)
Language: French
Currency: Euro (EUR)
about.climate_text: Annecy experiences a continental climate with cold winters and mild summers. Winter temperatures can drop below freezing, while summer temperatures range from 18°C (64°F) to 25°C (77°F). It's an ideal destination for both winter sports and summer adventures.

attractions_card.title: Palais de l'Isle
attractions_card.description: The Palais de l'Isle is a historic castle that served as a prison in the past. It's one of Annecy's most iconic landmarks and is located on an island in the Thiou River.

attractions_card.title: Château d'Annecy
attractions_card.description: Château d'Annecy is a beautiful castle overlooking the old town. It houses the Annecy Castle Museum, which showcases regional art and history.

attractions_card.title: Lake Annecy
attractions_card.description: Lake Annecy, often called Europe's cleanest lake, offers a wide range of water sports, swimming, and a scenic lakeside promenade.

attractions_card.title: Pont des Amours
attractions_card.description: The 'Lovers' Bridge' is a romantic spot over the Canal du Vassé. Legend has it that a kiss exchanged on this bridge guarantees eternal love.

attractions_card.title: Annecy Old Town
attractions_card.description: Wander through the medieval old town's winding streets, lined with colorful houses, charming boutiques, and delightful cafes.

attractions_card.title: Basilique de la Visitation
attractions_card.description: This stunning basilica offers panoramic views of Annecy and Lake Annecy. It's a place of serenity and architectural beauty.

attractions_card.title: Gorges du Fier
attractions_card.description: Explore the impressive natural beauty of Gorges du Fier, a narrow gorge with a footbridge that allows you to walk above the river.

attractions_card.title: Paragliding
attractions_card.description: Annecy is a paragliding paradise, and visitors can take to the skies to enjoy breathtaking aerial views of the town and surrounding landscapes.

food_card.title: Savoyard Cuisine
food_card.description: Indulge in Savoyard specialties such as raclette, fondue, and tartiflette, accompanied by delicious local wines.

food_card.title: Pâtisserie
food_card.description: Annecy offers a delectable range of French pastries and desserts, from macarons to tarts and éclairs.

food_card.title: Fresh Seafood
food_card.description: With its proximity to Lake Annecy, enjoy fresh fish and seafood dishes in the town's restaurants.

food_card.title: Local Markets
food_card.description: Visit local markets to discover fresh produce, cheeses, and a variety of regional specialties.

food_card.title: Annecy Beer
food_card.description: Sample locally brewed beers at Annecy's microbreweries, known for their craft beers.

hotels_card.title: Hôtel de l'Abbaye
hotels_card.description: Hôtel de l'Abbaye offers comfortable accommodations in the heart of Annecy's old town, providing a charming and historic atmosphere.

hotels_card.title: Impérial Palace Annecy
hotels_card.description: The Impérial Palace Annecy is a luxury hotel and casino overlooking Lake Annecy, providing a lavish and scenic stay.

hotels_card.title: Boutique Hotels
hotels_card.description: Annecy boasts boutique hotels with unique character and a personalized experience, often situated in the old town.

hotels_card.title: Budget Accommodations
hotels_card.description: For budget travelers, there are a variety of affordable guesthouses and hostels available in and around Annecy.

transport_card.title: Annecy Airport
transport_card.description: Annecy-Meythet Airport (NCY) is the closest airport, offering domestic and European flights for travelers.

transport_card.title: Public Transport
transport_card.description: Annecy has a well-connected network of buses for exploring the town and its surroundings, as well as the beautiful lakefront.

transport_card.title: Cycling
transport_card.description: Rent a bike and explore Annecy and its scenic countryside at your own pace, with dedicated bike paths and routes.

transport_card.title: Car Rentals
transport_card.description: Car rentals are available for those who wish to explore the surrounding Alpine landscapes and nearby attractions.
